name: github
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing github cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`github` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-github).

appAuth.description:
The GitHub App credentials used to connect to GitHub. Conflicts with `token`. Anonymous mode is enabled if both `token`
and `app_auth` are not set.

organization.description: The GitHub organization name to manage. Use this field instead of `owner` when managing organization accounts.
organization.deprecationMessage: Use owner (or GITHUB_OWNER) instead of organization (or GITHUB_ORGANIZATION)

owner.description: The GitHub owner name to manage. Use this field instead of `organization` when managing individual accounts.

token.description: The OAuth token used to connect to GitHub. Anonymous mode is enabled if both `token` and `app_auth` are not set.

writeDelayMs.description: Amount of time in milliseconds to sleep in between writes to GitHub API. Defaults to 1000ms or 1s if not set.

githubOwnedAllowed.description: Whether GitHub-owned actions are allowed in the organization.

patternsAlloweds.description: Specifies a list of string-matching patterns to allow specific action(s). Wildcards, tags, and SHAs are allowed. For example, monalisa/octocat@*, monalisa/octocat@v2, monalisa/*."

verifiedAllowed.description: Whether actions in GitHub Marketplace from verified creators are allowed. Set to true to allow all GitHub Marketplace actions by verified creators.

repositoryIds.description: List of repository IDs to enable for GitHub Actions.

customBranchPolicies.description: Whether only branches that match the specified name patterns can deploy to this environment.

protectedBranches.description: Whether only branches with branch protection rules can deploy to this environment.

teams.description: Up to 6 IDs for teams who may review jobs that reference the environment. Reviewers must have at least read access to the repository. Only one of the required reviewers needs to approve the job for it to proceed.

users.description: Up to 6 IDs for users who may review jobs that reference the environment. Reviewers must have at least read access to the repository. Only one of the required reviewers needs to approve the job for it to proceed.

cname.description: The custom domain for the repository. This can only be set after the repository has been created.

custom404.description: Whether the rendered GitHub Pages site has a custom 404 page.

htmlUrl.description: The absolute URL (including scheme) of the rendered GitHub Pages site e.g. `https://username.github.io`.

source.description: The source branch and directory for the rendered Pages site. See GitHub Pages Source below for details.

status.description: The GitHub Pages site's build status e.g. `building` or `built`.

branch.description: The repository branch used to publish the site's source files. (i.e. `main` or `gh-pages`.

path.description: The repository directory from which the site publishes (Default: `/`).

contentType.description: The content type for the payload. Valid values are either `form` or `json`.

insecureSsl.description: Insecure SSL boolean toggle. Defaults to `false`.

secret.description: The shared secret for the webhook. [See API documentation](https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/hooks/#create-a-hook).

groupDescription.description: The description of the IdP group.

groupId.description: The ID of the IdP group.

groupName.description: The name of the IdP group.

eventsUrl.description: The GitHub API URL for the collaborator's events.

followersUrl.description: The GitHub API URL for the collaborator's followers.

followingUrl.description: The GitHub API URL for those following the collaborator.

gistsUrl.description: The GitHub API URL for the collaborator's gists.

htmlUrl.description: The GitHub HTML URL for the collaborator.

id.description: The ID of the collaborator.

organizationsUrl.description: The GitHub API URL for the collaborator's organizations.

receivedEventsUrl.description: The GitHub API URL for the collaborator's received events.

reposUrl.description: The GitHub API URL for the collaborator's repositories.

siteAdmin.description: Whether the user is a GitHub admin.

starredUrl.description: The GitHub API URL for the collaborator's starred repositories.

subscriptionsUrl.description: The GitHub API URL for the collaborator's subscribed repositories.

url.description: The GitHub API URL for the collaborator.

groupDescription.description: The description of the IdP group.

groupId.description: The ID of the IdP group.

groupName.description: The name of the IdP group.

id.description: the ID of the team.

nodeId.description: the Node ID of the team.

htmlUrl.description: URL to the repository on the web.

baseRef.description: If set, filters Pull Requests by base branch name.

baseSha.description: Head commit SHA of the Pull Request base.

draft.description: Indicates Whether this Pull Request is a draft.

headOwner.description: Owner of the Pull Request head repository.

headRef.description: If set, filters Pull Requests by head user or head organization and branch name in the format of "user:ref-name" or "organization:ref-name". For example: "github:new-script-format" or "octocat:test-branch".

headRepository.description: Name of the Pull Request head repository.

headSha.description: Head commit SHA of the Pull Request head.

labels.description: List of label names set on the Pull Request.

maintainerCanModify.description: Indicates whether the base repository maintainers can modify the Pull Request.

number.description: The number of the Pull Request within the repository.

openedAt.description: Unix timestamp indicating the Pull Request creation time.

openedBy.description: GitHub login of the user who opened the Pull Request.

state.description: If set, filters Pull Requests by state. Can be "open", "closed", or "all". Default: "open".

title.description: The title of the Pull Request.

updatedAt.description: The timestamp of the last Pull Request update.

provider.description:
The provider type for the github package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

appAuth.description:
The GitHub App credentials used to connect to GitHub. Conflicts with `token`. Anonymous mode is enabled if both `token`
and `app_auth` are not set.

organization.description: The GitHub organization name to manage. Use this field instead of `owner` when managing organization accounts.
organization.deprecationMessage: Use owner (or GITHUB_OWNER) instead of organization (or GITHUB_ORGANIZATION)

owner.description: The GitHub owner name to manage. Use this field instead of `organization` when managing individual accounts.

token.description: The OAuth token used to connect to GitHub. Anonymous mode is enabled if both `token` and `app_auth` are not set.

writeDelayMs.description: Amount of time in milliseconds to sleep in between writes to GitHub API. Defaults to 1000ms or 1s if not set.

appAuth.description:
The GitHub App credentials used to connect to GitHub. Conflicts with `token`. Anonymous mode is enabled if both `token`
and `app_auth` are not set.

organization.description: The GitHub organization name to manage. Use this field instead of `owner` when managing organization accounts.
organization.deprecationMessage: Use owner (or GITHUB_OWNER) instead of organization (or GITHUB_ORGANIZATION)

owner.description: The GitHub owner name to manage. Use this field instead of `organization` when managing individual accounts.

token.description: The OAuth token used to connect to GitHub. Anonymous mode is enabled if both `token` and `app_auth` are not set.

writeDelayMs.description: Amount of time in milliseconds to sleep in between writes to GitHub API. Defaults to 1000ms or 1s if not set.

github:index/actionsEnvironmentSecret:Ac.description:
## Import

This resource can be imported using an ID made up of the secret name

```sh
 $ pulumi import github:index/actionsEnvironmentSecret:ActionsEnvironmentSecret test_secret test_secret_name
```

 NOTEthe implementation is limited in that it won't fetch the value of the `plaintext_value` field when importing. You may need to ignore changes for the `plaintext_value` as a workaround.

encryptedValue.description: Encrypted value of the secret using the Github public key in Base64 format.

plaintextValue.description: Plaintext value of the secret to be encrypted.

encryptedValue.description: Encrypted value of the secret using the Github public key in Base64 format.

plaintextValue.description: Plaintext value of the secret to be encrypted.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering ActionsEnvironmentSecret resources.

encryptedValue.description: Encrypted value of the secret using the Github public key in Base64 format.

plaintextValue.description: Plaintext value of the secret to be encrypted.

allowedActions.description: The permissions policy that controls the actions that are allowed to run. Can be one of: `all`, `local_only`, or `selected`.

allowedActionsConfig.description: Sets the actions that are allowed in an organization. Only available when `allowed_actions` = `selected`. See Allowed Actions Config below for details.

enabledRepositories.description: The policy that controls the repositories in the organization that are allowed to run GitHub Actions. Can be one of: `all`, `none`, or `selected`.

enabledRepositoriesConfig.description: Sets the list of selected repositories that are enabled for GitHub Actions in an organization. Only available when `enabled_repositories` = `selected`. See Enabled Repositories Config below for details.

allowedActions.description: The permissions policy that controls the actions that are allowed to run. Can be one of: `all`, `local_only`, or `selected`.

allowedActionsConfig.description: Sets the actions that are allowed in an organization. Only available when `allowed_actions` = `selected`. See Allowed Actions Config below for details.

enabledRepositories.description: The policy that controls the repositories in the organization that are allowed to run GitHub Actions. Can be one of: `all`, `none`, or `selected`.

enabledRepositoriesConfig.description: Sets the list of selected repositories that are enabled for GitHub Actions in an organization. Only available when `enabled_repositories` = `selected`. See Enabled Repositories Config below for details.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering ActionsOrganizationPermissions resources.

allowedActions.description: The permissions policy that controls the actions that are allowed to run. Can be one of: `all`, `local_only`, or `selected`.

allowedActionsConfig.description: Sets the actions that are allowed in an organization. Only available when `allowed_actions` = `selected`. See Allowed Actions Config below for details.

enabledRepositories.description: The policy that controls the repositories in the organization that are allowed to run GitHub Actions. Can be one of: `all`, `none`, or `selected`.

enabledRepositoriesConfig.description: Sets the list of selected repositories that are enabled for GitHub Actions in an organization. Only available when `enabled_repositories` = `selected`. See Enabled Repositories Config below for details.

github:index/actionsOrganizationSecret:A.description:
## Import

This resource can be imported using an ID made up of the secret name

```sh
 $ pulumi import github:index/actionsOrganizationSecret:ActionsOrganizationSecret test_secret test_secret_name
```

 NOTEthe implementation is limited in that it won't fetch the value of the `plaintext_value` or `encrypted_value` fields when importing. You may need to ignore changes for these as a workaround.

encryptedValue.description: Encrypted value of the secret using the Github public key in Base64 format.

plaintextValue.description: Plaintext value of the secret to be encrypted

selectedRepositoryIds.description: An array of repository ids that can access the organization secret.

visibility.description:
Configures the access that repositories have to the organization secret.
Must be one of `all`, `private`, `selected`. `selected_repository_ids` is required if set to `selected`.

plaintextValue.description: Plaintext value of the secret to be encrypted

Must be one of `all`, `private`, `selected`. `selected_repository_ids` is required if set to `selected`.

plaintextValue.description: Plaintext value of the secret to be encrypted

Must be one of `all`, `private`, `selected`. `selected_repository_ids` is required if set to `selected`.

allowsPublicRepositories.description: Whether public repositories can be added to the runner group

default.description: Whether this is the default runner group

etag.description: An etag representing the runner group object

inherited.description: Whether the runner group is inherited from the enterprise level

runnersUrl.description: The GitHub API URL for the runner group's runners

selectedRepositoriesUrl.description: Github API URL for the runner group's repositories

selectedRepositoryIds.description: IDs of the repositories which should be added to the runner group

visibility.description: Visibility of a runner group. Whether the runner group can include `all`, `selected`, or `private` repositories. A value of `private` is not currently supported due to limitations in the GitHub API.

selectedRepositoryIds.description: IDs of the repositories which should be added to the runner group

repository.description: The repository to install the app on.

etag.description: An etag representing the Branch object.

ref.description: A string representing a branch reference, in the form of `refs/heads/<branch>`.

sha.description: A string storing the reference's `HEAD` commit's SHA1.

sourceBranch.description: The branch name to start from. Defaults to `main`.

sourceSha.description: The commit hash to start from. Defaults to the tip of `source_branch`. If provided, `source_branch` is ignored.

sourceBranch.description: The branch name to start from. Defaults to `main`.

allowsDeletions.description: Boolean, setting this to `true` to allow the branch to be deleted.

allowsForcePushes.description: Boolean, setting this to `true` to allow force pushes on the branch.

enforceAdmins.description: Boolean, setting this to `true` enforces status checks for repository administrators.

pushRestrictions.description: The list of actor IDs that may push to the branch.

repositoryId.description: The name or node ID of the repository associated with this branch protection rule.

requireConversationResolution.description: Boolean, setting this to `true` requires all conversations on code must be resolved before a pull request can be merged.

requireSignedCommits.description: Boolean, setting this to `true` requires all commits to be signed with GPG.

requiredLinearHistory.description: Boolean, setting this to `true` enforces a linear commit Git history, which prevents anyone from pushing merge commits to a branch

requiredPullRequestReviews.description: Enforce restrictions for pull request reviews. See Required Pull Request Reviews below for details.

requiredStatusChecks.description: Enforce restrictions for required status checks. See Required Status Checks below for details.

github:index/issueLabel:IssueLabel.description:
## Import

GitHub Issue Labels can be imported using an ID made up of `repository:name`, e.g.

```sh
 $ pulumi import github:index/issueLabel:IssueLabel panic_label terraform:panic
```

color.description: A 6 character hex code, **without the leading #**, identifying the color of the label.

description.description: A short description of the label.

url.description: The URL to the issue label

color.description: A 6 character hex code, **without the leading #**, identifying the color of the label.

description.description: A short description of the label.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering IssueLabel resources.

color.description: A 6 character hex code, **without the leading #**, identifying the color of the label.

description.description: A short description of the label.

url.description: The URL to the issue label

role.description:
The role of the user within the organization.
Must be one of `member` or `admin`. Defaults to `member`.

username.description: The user to add to the organization.

The role of the user within the organization.
Must be one of `member` or `admin`. Defaults to `member`.

The role of the user within the organization.
Must be one of `member` or `admin`. Defaults to `member`.

The name of the user to block.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering OrganizationProject resources.

active.description: Indicate of the webhook should receive events. Defaults to `true`.

configuration.description: key/value pair of configuration for this webhook. Available keys are `url`, `content_type`, `secret` and `insecure_ssl`.

events.description: A list of events which should trigger the webhook. See a list of [available events](https://developer.github.com/v3/activity/events/types/)

active.description: Indicate of the webhook should receive events. Defaults to `true`.

note.description: The note contents of the card. Markdown supported.
The note contents of the card. Markdown supported.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering ProjectCard resources.

note.description: The note contents of the card. Markdown supported.

projectId.description: The ID of an existing project that the column will be created in.
The ID of an existing project that the column will be created in.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering ProjectColumn resources.

projectId.description: The ID of an existing project that the column will be created in.

allowAutoMerge.description: Set to `true` to allow auto-merging pull requests on the repository.

allowMergeCommit.description: Set to `false` to disable merge commits on the repository.

allowRebaseMerge.description: Set to `false` to disable rebase merges on the repository.

allowSquashMerge.description: Set to `false` to disable squash merges on the repository.

archiveOnDestroy.description: Set to `true` to archive the repository instead of deleting on destroy.

archived.description: Specifies if the repository should be archived. Defaults to `false`. **NOTE** Currently, the API does not support unarchiving.

autoInit.description: Set to `true` to produce an initial commit in the repository.

branches.description: The list of this repository's branches. Each element of `branches` has the following attributes:

defaultBranch.description:
(Deprecated: Use `github.BranchDefault` resource instead) The name of the default branch of the repository. **NOTE:** This can only be set after a repository has already been created,
and after a correct reference has been created for the target branch inside the repository. This means a user will have to omit this parameter from the
initial repository creation and create the target branch inside of the repository prior to setting this attribute.

deleteBranchOnMerge.description: Automatically delete head branch after a pull request is merged. Defaults to `false`.

gitCloneUrl.description: URL that can be provided to `git clone` to clone the repository anonymously via the git protocol.

gitignoreTemplate.description: Use the [name of the template](https://github.com/github/gitignore) without the extension. For example, "Haskell".

hasDownloads.description: Set to `true` to enable the (deprecated) downloads features on the repository.

hasIssues.description:
Set to `true` to enable the GitHub Issues features
on the repository.

hasProjects.description: Set to `true` to enable the GitHub Projects features on the repository. Per the GitHub [documentation](https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/#create) when in an organization that has disabled repository projects it will default to `false` and will otherwise default to `true`. If you specify `true` when it has been disabled it will return an error.

hasWiki.description:
Set to `true` to enable the GitHub Wiki features on
the repository.

homepageUrl.description: URL of a page describing the project.

htmlUrl.description: The absolute URL (including scheme) of the rendered GitHub Pages site e.g. `https://username.github.io`.

httpCloneUrl.description: URL that can be provided to `git clone` to clone the repository via HTTPS.

isTemplate.description: Set to `true` to tell GitHub that this is a template repository.

licenseTemplate.description: Use the [name of the template](https://github.com/github/choosealicense.com/tree/gh-pages/_licenses) without the extension. For example, "mit" or "mpl-2.0".

nodeId.description: GraphQL global node id for use with v4 API

pages.description: The repository's GitHub Pages configuration. See GitHub Pages Configuration below for details.

private.description:
Set to `true` to create a private repository.
Repositories are created as public (e.g. open source) by default.

sshCloneUrl.description: URL that can be provided to `git clone` to clone the repository via SSH.

svnUrl.description: URL that can be provided to `svn checkout` to check out the repository via GitHub's Subversion protocol emulation.

template.description: Use a template repository to create this resource. See Template Repositories below for details.

topics.description: The list of topics of the repository.

visibility.description: Can be `public` or `private`. If your organization is associated with an enterprise account using GitHub Enterprise Cloud or GitHub Enterprise Server 2.20+, visibility can also be `internal`. The `visibility` parameter overrides the `private` parameter.

vulnerabilityAlerts.description: Set to `true` to enable security alerts for vulnerable dependencies. Enabling requires alerts to be enabled on the owner level. (Note for importing: GitHub enables the alerts on public repos but disables them on private repos by default.) See [GitHub Documentation](https://help.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-security-alerts-for-vulnerable-dependencies) for details. Note that vulnerability alerts have not been successfully tested on any GitHub Enterprise instance and may be unavailable in those settings.

allowAutoMerge.description: Set to `true` to allow auto-merging pull requests on the repository.

allowMergeCommit.description: Set to `false` to disable merge commits on the repository.

allowRebaseMerge.description: Set to `false` to disable rebase merges on the repository.

allowSquashMerge.description: Set to `false` to disable squash merges on the repository.

archiveOnDestroy.description: Set to `true` to archive the repository instead of deleting on destroy.

archived.description: Specifies if the repository should be archived. Defaults to `false`. **NOTE** Currently, the API does not support unarchiving.

autoInit.description: Set to `true` to produce an initial commit in the repository.

defaultBranch.description:
(Deprecated: Use `github.BranchDefault` resource instead) The name of the default branch of the repository. **NOTE:** This can only be set after a repository has already been created,
and after a correct reference has been created for the target branch inside the repository. This means a user will have to omit this parameter from the
initial repository creation and create the target branch inside of the repository prior to setting this attribute.

deleteBranchOnMerge.description: Automatically delete head branch after a pull request is merged. Defaults to `false`.

gitignoreTemplate.description: Use the [name of the template](https://github.com/github/gitignore) without the extension. For example, "Haskell".

hasDownloads.description: Set to `true` to enable the (deprecated) downloads features on the repository.

hasIssues.description:
Set to `true` to enable the GitHub Issues features
on the repository.

hasProjects.description: Set to `true` to enable the GitHub Projects features on the repository. Per the GitHub [documentation](https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/#create) when in an organization that has disabled repository projects it will default to `false` and will otherwise default to `true`. If you specify `true` when it has been disabled it will return an error.

hasWiki.description:
Set to `true` to enable the GitHub Wiki features on
the repository.

homepageUrl.description: URL of a page describing the project.

isTemplate.description: Set to `true` to tell GitHub that this is a template repository.

licenseTemplate.description: Use the [name of the template](https://github.com/github/choosealicense.com/tree/gh-pages/_licenses) without the extension. For example, "mit" or "mpl-2.0".

pages.description: The repository's GitHub Pages configuration. See GitHub Pages Configuration below for details.

private.description:
Set to `true` to create a private repository.
Repositories are created as public (e.g. open source) by default.

template.description: Use a template repository to create this resource. See Template Repositories below for details.

topics.description: The list of topics of the repository.

visibility.description: Can be `public` or `private`. If your organization is associated with an enterprise account using GitHub Enterprise Cloud or GitHub Enterprise Server 2.20+, visibility can also be `internal`. The `visibility` parameter overrides the `private` parameter.

vulnerabilityAlerts.description: Set to `true` to enable security alerts for vulnerable dependencies. Enabling requires alerts to be enabled on the owner level. (Note for importing: GitHub enables the alerts on public repos but disables them on private repos by default.) See [GitHub Documentation](https://help.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-security-alerts-for-vulnerable-dependencies) for details. Note that vulnerability alerts have not been successfully tested on any GitHub Enterprise instance and may be unavailable in those settings.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Repository resources.

allowAutoMerge.description: Set to `true` to allow auto-merging pull requests on the repository.

allowMergeCommit.description: Set to `false` to disable merge commits on the repository.

allowRebaseMerge.description: Set to `false` to disable rebase merges on the repository.

allowSquashMerge.description: Set to `false` to disable squash merges on the repository.

archiveOnDestroy.description: Set to `true` to archive the repository instead of deleting on destroy.

archived.description: Specifies if the repository should be archived. Defaults to `false`. **NOTE** Currently, the API does not support unarchiving.

autoInit.description: Set to `true` to produce an initial commit in the repository.

branches.description: The list of this repository's branches. Each element of `branches` has the following attributes:

defaultBranch.description:
(Deprecated: Use `github.BranchDefault` resource instead) The name of the default branch of the repository. **NOTE:** This can only be set after a repository has already been created,
and after a correct reference has been created for the target branch inside the repository. This means a user will have to omit this parameter from the
initial repository creation and create the target branch inside of the repository prior to setting this attribute.

deleteBranchOnMerge.description: Automatically delete head branch after a pull request is merged. Defaults to `false`.

gitCloneUrl.description: URL that can be provided to `git clone` to clone the repository anonymously via the git protocol.

gitignoreTemplate.description: Use the [name of the template](https://github.com/github/gitignore) without the extension. For example, "Haskell".

hasDownloads.description: Set to `true` to enable the (deprecated) downloads features on the repository.

hasIssues.description:
Set to `true` to enable the GitHub Issues features
on the repository.

hasProjects.description: Set to `true` to enable the GitHub Projects features on the repository. Per the GitHub [documentation](https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/#create) when in an organization that has disabled repository projects it will default to `false` and will otherwise default to `true`. If you specify `true` when it has been disabled it will return an error.

hasWiki.description:
Set to `true` to enable the GitHub Wiki features on
the repository.

homepageUrl.description: URL of a page describing the project.

htmlUrl.description: The absolute URL (including scheme) of the rendered GitHub Pages site e.g. `https://username.github.io`.

httpCloneUrl.description: URL that can be provided to `git clone` to clone the repository via HTTPS.

isTemplate.description: Set to `true` to tell GitHub that this is a template repository.

licenseTemplate.description: Use the [name of the template](https://github.com/github/choosealicense.com/tree/gh-pages/_licenses) without the extension. For example, "mit" or "mpl-2.0".

nodeId.description: GraphQL global node id for use with v4 API

pages.description: The repository's GitHub Pages configuration. See GitHub Pages Configuration below for details.

private.description:
Set to `true` to create a private repository.
Repositories are created as public (e.g. open source) by default.

sshCloneUrl.description: URL that can be provided to `git clone` to clone the repository via SSH.

svnUrl.description: URL that can be provided to `svn checkout` to check out the repository via GitHub's Subversion protocol emulation.

template.description: Use a template repository to create this resource. See Template Repositories below for details.

topics.description: The list of topics of the repository.

visibility.description: Can be `public` or `private`. If your organization is associated with an enterprise account using GitHub Enterprise Cloud or GitHub Enterprise Server 2.20+, visibility can also be `internal`. The `visibility` parameter overrides the `private` parameter.

vulnerabilityAlerts.description: Set to `true` to enable security alerts for vulnerable dependencies. Enabling requires alerts to be enabled on the owner level. (Note for importing: GitHub enables the alerts on public repos but disables them on private repos by default.) See [GitHub Documentation](https://help.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-security-alerts-for-vulnerable-dependencies) for details. Note that vulnerability alerts have not been successfully tested on any GitHub Enterprise instance and may be unavailable in those settings.

github:index/teamSyncGroupMapping:TeamSy.description:
This resource allows you to create and manage Identity Provider (IdP) group connections within your GitHub teams.
You must have team synchronization enabled for organizations owned by enterprise accounts.

To learn more about team synchronization between IdPs and GitHub, please refer to:
https://help.github.com/en/github/setting-up-and-managing-organizations-and-teams/synchronizing-teams-between-your-identity-provider-and-github


## Import

GitHub Team Sync Group Mappings can be imported using the GitHub team `slug` e.g.

```sh
 $ pulumi import github:index/teamSyncGroupMapping:TeamSyncGroupMapping example some_team
```

repository.description: The repository to create the file in.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getRepositoryFile.

commitMessage.description: Commit message when file was last updated.

commitSha.description: The SHA of the commit that modified the file.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

sha.description: The SHA blob of the file.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getRepositoryMilestone.

repository.description: Name of the repository to retrieve the milestone from.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getRepositoryMilestone.

dueDate.description: The milestone due date (in ISO-8601 `yyyy-mm-dd` format).

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getRepositoryPullRequest.

baseRepository.description: Name of the base repository to retrieve the Pull Request from.

number.description: The number of the Pull Request within the repository.

owner.description: Owner of the repository. If not provided, the provider's default owner is used.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getRepositoryPullRequest.

baseRef.description: Name of the ref (branch) of the Pull Request base.

baseSha.description: Head commit SHA of the Pull Request base.

draft.description: Indicates Whether this Pull Request is a draft.

headOwner.description: Owner of the Pull Request head repository.

headRepository.description: Name of the Pull Request head repository.

headSha.description: Head commit SHA of the Pull Request head.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

labels.description: List of label names set on the Pull Request.

maintainerCanModify.description: Indicates whether the base repository maintainers can modify the Pull Request.

openedAt.description: Unix timestamp indicating the Pull Request creation time.

openedBy.description: GitHub login of the user who opened the Pull Request.

state.description: the current Pull Request state - can be "open", "closed" or "merged".

title.description: The title of the Pull Request.

updatedAt.description: The timestamp of the last Pull Request update.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getRepositoryPullRequests.

baseRef.description: If set, filters Pull Requests by base branch name.

baseRepository.description: Name of the base repository to retrieve the Pull Requests from.

headRef.description: If set, filters Pull Requests by head user or head organization and branch name in the format of "user:ref-name" or "organization:ref-name". For example: "github:new-script-format" or "octocat:test-branch".

owner.description: Owner of the repository. If not provided, the provider's default owner is used.

sortBy.description: If set, indicates what to sort results by. Can be either "created", "updated", "popularity" (comment count) or "long-running" (age, filtering by pulls updated in the last month). Default: "created".

sortDirection.description: If set, controls the direction of the sort. Can be either "asc" or "desc". Default: "asc".

state.description: If set, filters Pull Requests by state. Can be "open", "closed", or "all". Default: "open".

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getRepositoryPullRequests.

baseRef.description: Name of the ref (branch) of the Pull Request base.

headRef.description: Value of the Pull Request `HEAD` reference.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

results.description: Collection of Pull Requests matching the filters. Each of the results conforms to the following scheme:

state.description: the current Pull Request state - can be "open", "closed" or "merged".

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getTeam.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getTeam.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

nodeId.description: the Node ID of the team.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getUser.

username.description: The username. Use an empty string `""` to retrieve information about the currently authenticated user.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getUser.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

nodeId.description: the Node ID of the user.

siteAdmin.description: whether the user is a GitHub admin.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getUsers.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getUsers.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

logins.description: list of logins of users that could be found.

nodeIds.description: list of Node IDs of users that could be found.

unknownLogins.description: list of logins without matching user.

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing github cloud resources.
